meanings.definition: The act of drifting or being carried along by currents.
meanings.sent1: The driftages of the leaves in the river showed the power of the water's movement.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen noticed the driftages of seaweed floating downstream.
meanings.sent3: The ducks used the driftages of the stream to have a lazy ride downstream.
meanings.sent4: The driftages of clouds in the sky painted a beautiful picture above us.
meanings.sent5: The driftages of dust in the wind danced gracefully in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Accumulated debris or waste that has drifted or been carried along by currents.
meanings.sent1: The beach was littered with driftages of plastic bottles and wrappers.
meanings.sent2: The ocean cleanup crew worked hard to collect the driftages of garbage floating at sea.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls scavenged among the driftages of trash for any edible scraps.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with driftages of fallen leaves after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The landfill was overflowing with driftages of old furniture and broken appliances.
